comp3111.webscraper

Class WebScraper

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp3111.webscraper.WebScraper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    craigsSpider

    public class WebScraper
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which is used to scrape the queried item from 2 portals: amazon and newyork craigslist. Title or name, price, posted date, url of the item, portal of each item were scraped. This class massively parallelised the posted date retrieval of amazon items and craigslist pagination using multi-threading in java application, resulting in significantly improved performance of the webscraper. HtmlUnit web driver (netscape as its default) is used for the web driver.
    Author:
    nwihardjo

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        private static java.lang.String getTitle(com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlElement item,
                                         java.lang.String portal)
        Get the title of the item using a specific XPath address for each portal. Amazon could have a result which is not an item, known by the title of the result having different XPath address. Utilised cleanStr method to parse / clean the title for amazon (i.e. containing [sponsored], etc).
        Parameters:
        item - containing one specific item from either portal
        portal - which the item originated (amazon / craigslist)
        Returns:
        title of the item

      • scrapePage

        protected static java.util.ArrayList<Item> scrapePage(com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage page)
        Get every items and its information from a single page of craigslist. Used as a method to support pagination feature for craigslist portal, pages were retrieved by scrape method. Called by craigslist spiders
        Parameters:
        page - a single page of the craigslist portal
        Returns:
        list of the item present in the page
        See Also:
        craigsSpider

      • getPrice

        private static java.lang.Double getPrice(com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlElement item,
                                         java.lang.String portal)
        Retrieve the price of an amazon's or craigslist's item based on its XPath address. For amazon item, if main price present, only the main price will be used. If main price does not present, cheapest price of offers / other buying options , if any, will be used. If the stated price were a range, avose your Free Limited Edition Gift! erage of the price range will be used. Utilised cleanStr method to clean / parse the price (i.e. containing $, ",", etc). If no price exists, price will be 0.
        Parameters:
        item - HtmlElement which containing only a single item
        portal - name of the portal the passed item came from
        Returns:
        price of the item in USD based on the condition described

      • cleanStr

        private static java.lang.String cleanStr(java.lang.String str,
                                         java.lang.String use)
        Clean or parse string based on the usage (for title or price)
        Parameters:
        str - string going to be parsed / cleaned
        use - name of the method which call this method
        Returns:
        cleaned / parsed string

      • getUrl

        private static java.lang.String getUrl(com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlElement item,
                                       java.lang.String portal)
        Scrape the url of the page of the item from either portal (amazon / craigslist)
        Parameters:
        item - HtmlElement consisting of a single item
        portal - name of the website where the passed item came from
        Returns:
        url of the item page in its respective portal

      • getPostedDate

        private static java.util.Date getPostedDate(com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlElement item)
        Retrieve the date of the time when the item is posted. This method is only implemented for craigslist only. Date of the posted time of amazon's items were retrieved in deploySpider function.
        Parameters:
        item - HtmlElement consisting of a single item
        Returns:
        date of when the item is posted in HKT (Hong Kong Time). Return null when there is no available information on the posted date.

      • sortResult

        private static java.util.Vector<Item> sortResult(java.util.ArrayList<Item> amazonArrayList,
                                                 java.util.ArrayList<Item> craigsArrayList)
        Sort the result (items) retrieved from both portals ascending. When two items from two portals has the same price the item from craigslist will go first. The items from each portal were sorted ascendingly first.
        Parameters:
        amazonArrayList - list of the items retrieved from amazon portal
        craigsArrayList - list of the items retrieved from craigslist portal
        Returns:
        list of sorted items based on the condition described

      • deploySpiders

        private java.util.ArrayList<Item> deploySpiders(java.util.ArrayList<Item> amazonArrayList)
        Parallelisation to retrieve the posted date of the amazon item which is stored in each of the item's page. Multi-threading were used to intialise multiple webclients to scrape amazon's items pages concurrently, using a thread pool with the size of the number of item present in a single page of the amazon. Each thread then return the scraped posted date of each item and update the value of the posted date of the item.
        Parameters:
        amazonArrayList - list of items present in a single page of amazon portal
        Returns:
        same list of items passed with updated posted date value, if any

      • roundUp

        private static java.lang.Integer roundUp(java.lang.Double d)
        Method called to round up Double type for craigslist page calculation
        Parameters:
        d - Double variable to be rounded up
        Returns:
        integer as a rounded up of the passed parameter

      • scrape

        public java.util.List<Item> scrape(java.lang.String keyword,
                                   Controller controller)
        Method to manage the workflow of scraping both portals based on the keyword specified. Handle amazon portal first, then the craigslist sequentially. Pagination of amazon is not handled, item's posted date retrieval is done concurrently, after all of the items have been collected. Pagination of craigslist is handled concurrently.
        Parameters:
        keyword - the keyword you want to search
        controller - instance of which call this function, to update user on the scraping progress
        Returns:
        A list of Item that has found. A zero size list is return if nothing is found. Null if any exception (e.g. no connectivity)
